data.title: Ranking, Courses, Admission 2024 & Fees
data.meta_description: Explore in-depth details on the Lakehead University, covering Courses, Acceptance Rate, Rankings, Fees, Eligibility, Admission Process, and Scholarships.
data.text:
Lakehead University (LU) is a large public research university in Thunder Bay, Ontario, Canada. It was founded in 1965 and provides a diverse range of undergraduate and postgraduate study opportunities, with over 60 subjects of study to select from. Their academic divisions include aboriginal education, biology, law, business, education, music, and many more subjects. Furthermore, the institution is home to 11 Canada Research Chairs as well as ground-breaking facilities such as the world-renowned Paleo DNA Laboratory and the Bio-refining Research Institute.

The university has two campuses, one each in Orillia and Thunder Bay. The Thunder Bay Campus is home to 7,500 students in total. The campus in Orillia is home to more than 1,500 students. The Thunder Bay campus is surrounded by fields and greenery, and since all the buildings are situated in the same area, the school has a unique campus feel to it. Over 70 countries are represented among Lakehead's overseas students. The university has ten major faculties as listed below -

Business Administration

Education

Engineering

Graduate Studies

Health & Behavioural Sciences

Law

Medicine

Natural Resources Management

Science & Environmental Studies

Social Sciences & Humanities

Lakehead is a pioneer in post-diploma programs in engineering and many other fields, making it a leader in college transfer options. Thanks to its more than 26 cutting-edge research institutes and 11 Canada Research Chairs, Lakehead University provides students with access to unparalleled hands-on research opportunities at both the undergraduate and graduate levels. With Lakehead Universityâ€™s acceptance rate at 82%, it is one of the most reputable colleges with a lightly selective admissions procedure.

Experiential learning opportunities are offered to students to apply classroom learning in real-world settings. Because of the low student-to-professor ratio, students may study through a unique blend of academic mentorship, practical learning, and cutting-edge research. The institution is well-known around the world for its research expertise. The AACSB has globally certified its business school.

Lakehead University Entry Requirements

The academic years of Fall, Winter, and Spring/Summer all provide admission to Lakehead. There are several pre-admission requirements for documentation that will aid students in being accepted. The Lakehead University entry requirements, which change depending on the course selection, degree level, and other factors, must be met by international students. The requirements that students must fulfil in order to apply to the university are listed below -

Official Academic Transcripts

A minimum of 70% in secondary school or its Canadian equivalent

English Language Proficiency scores- CAEL: 60; Duolingo English Test: 110; IELTS: 6.5; Michigan English Test: 85; PTE:58

Reference Letters

Statement of goals

Research Outline

Resume/CV

Standardised Test Scores

Lakehead University Fees

The cost of attending Lakehead depends on several factors and the fees are subject to change. It is recommended that international students check the university website portal for the revised Lakehead University fees for their specific courses. Courses like MBA and Engineering may be more expensive. Additionally, overseas students pay higher tuition fees than domestic students. However, students can apply for financial aid via scholarships to study in Canada which could help them offset both, their tuition and living expenses. Below is a list of the average course-wise fees at the university -

MBA - CAD 41,811

MSc Computer Science - CAD 23,811

BSc Computer Science - CAD 28,589

B.Com Business - CAD 31,351

PhD Biotechnology - CAD 15,078

Diploma Civil Engineering - CAD 21,944

Lakehead University Placement

Lakehead University's average rate of employment for undergraduate program graduates six months after graduation in 2012 was 89.3%, higher than the 87.6% average for the Ontario university system, according to official sources. In 2012, the employment rate in Computer Science was 96.5%, whereas it was 94.1% in Engineering. Mathematics has a 92.1% employment rate. The following are the most popular firms that hire graduates and offer Lakehead University placements to students -

Lakehead University

Hatch

MPE Engineering

Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce (CIBC) and Resolute
